body.p:
State of Kentucky
Harlan County
To Beriah Magoffin

Govenor of The Commonwealth of Kentucky Your petitioner ^John Pace^ would humbly State that at the April Term 1858 of the Harlan Circuit Court he was accused of the Offence of Buggery and upon a trial of said offence he was by a Jury of the County found guilty and his confinement fixed at the Term of Two years He says now he has been so confined at hard Labor, in accordance to the Judgt of the Court about Eighteen Months, He says according to testimony and law he was ^found^ guilty but the testimony upon which the conviction was had was faulse. He says he was a resident of Harlan County having married in said County and having three small children in said county upon the cold charaties of the world he says he is poor and understands his family greatly needs his assistance
Wherefore he prays your Excellency to pardon him, and extend Mercy toward him and his little family and will ever pray & and we the undersigned Join in the prayer of the said Pace
